CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 30, 1955, pg. 11, reads: "Metoka Garden Party- The Metoka Club sponsored its annual scholarship garden party last Thursday on the lawn of the Church of the Holy Cross, with hundreds from Pittsburgh and surrounding communities in attendance.  A partial group of the large crowd was caught by cameraman "Teenie" Harris of The Courier.  in extreme left is Mrs. James Woodruff introducing popular disc jockey, Mary Dee, who served as mistress of ceremonies.  Over fifteen hundred dollars was raised at the affair.  Thirteen contestants competed for the cash awards."
TitMainTitle: Large audience of children, men, and women, including Mary Dee standing on left wearing large light colored hat, and light colored short sleeved dress, for Metoka Club's annual scholarship garden party at the Church of Holy Cross
